title: Earthquake Preparedness: Before, During & After
description: Learn what to do before, during, and after an earthquake to protect yourself and your loved ones.

sections.title: Before an Earthquake
sections.content:
## Understand Your Risk

- Find out if you live in an area prone to earthquakes.

## Practice Drop, Cover, and Hold On

- During an earthquake, you should Drop, Cover, and Hold On to protect yourself from falling debris.

## Secure Your Space

- Identify and secure items that might fall during shaking, such as televisions, shelves, and mirrors.

## Plan to Stay Connected

- Have a backup battery or a way to charge your cell phone.

## Learn Emergency Skills

- Learn First Aid and CPR to help others.

sections.title: During an Earthquake
sections.content:
## When shaking starts, DROP, COVER, and HOLD ON

- If you are in bed, stay there and cover your head and neck with a pillow.
- If you are outdoors, drop, then crawl towards open space if you can.
- If you are driving, stop and stay in your vehicle.

sections.title: After an Earthquake
sections.content:
## Stay Safe

- Wait a minute before getting up. Check for any immediate dangers around you.
- If it is safe, exit the building and go to a clear area.
- Expect aftershocks and Drop, Cover, and Hold On whenever you feel shaking.

## Check Your Home for Safety

- Inspect the outside of your home for damage before re-entering.
- Check for damage to gas, water, electrical, and sewage systems.
